results.title: African village life: building a boat on the Niger
results.brief_description: Shows how members of the Bozo tribe build a boat with limited tools and materials: glue, nails, strips of cloth and mud are used to make the boat watertight.

results.title: African continent: an introduction
results.brief_description: An overview of the African continent; relationship between geographic factors; cultures and development of the people of each region; different climates; tropical rain forests, savanna, desert, Mediterranean; mountain ranges; rivers; population; European influence; crops; mineral resources; and progress being made as transportation, roads, machinery and water power development are improved. Problems created by emergence from old to new ways are introduced.

results.title: African awakening
results.creator_credit: Peter Hopkinson, James Carr and World Wide Pictures
results.brief_description: Explores the many factors influencing the future of Nigeria, Ghana and Sierra Leone. Shows these young nations adapting their traditiional social ways and cultures to the challenge of our times. Side by side with the traditional, a new Africa is growing and the film is an expression of the attitudes of those African men and women who are today the driving force of West African progress.

results.title: African animals
results.brief_description: Depicts the drama of a day on the African savanna. Shows a variety of animals hunting, feeding and providing for their young. No narration.

results.title: Africa: a new look
results.creator_credit: Sam Bryan and International Film Foundation
results.brief_description: A comprehensive survey which concentrates on the people of Africa today in all walks of life, and with glimpses of life in the cities, towns and villages. Shows some of the economic and social changes that are taking place throughout the many nations of Africa. An animated map sequence pinpoints deserts, farmland, rivers and major population areas. A final sequence focuses on South Africa and Namibia, where the official racial policies are opposed by Africans throughout the continent. Suitable for lower and middle secondary level.

results.title: Africa untamed
results.brief_description: Documentary examining life and customs in Equatorial Africa. The film follows a boat trip through pygmie country to a pygmie village and shows hunters at work spearing a leopard. The problems of tsi tsi fly and sleeping sickness in big game country are discussed and the behavioural traits of the wild life found in this area, such as giraffes, rhinos and hippos, are examined. Also shows a hunting party in action in elephant country.

results.title: Africa is my home
results.creator_credit: J. Michael Hagopian and Atlantis Productions
results.brief_description: The life of a Nigerian woman from birth to marriage, as she faces the basic issues of tradition versus progress, Christianity versus Islam, and colonialism versus independence. The strength of family and tribal ties; the happy village life of her childhood; her first awareness of the different religious faiths around her; going to the mission school and being fired by her father’s zeal for independence; growing awareness of political and social problems as she goes to teachers college; her fiance’s graduation from university and his decision to work in the service of his country; their marriage in a Christian church.

results.title: Afghanistan: threads of life
results.creator_credit: Irwin Dermer and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Provides an overview of aspects of the way of life in Afghanistan. Shows the age old methods of making grape juice, rug making, baking, and salt grinding. Also shows the lifestyle of the camel traders and the atmosphere of the bazaars where the rug and carpet makers go to find the best possible price for their wares.

results.title: Affordable Housing: Dream or Reality
results.brief_description: With changing lifestyles and the enormous cost of buying a freestanding home, this video looks at basic alternative design elements in housing and town planning to accommodate both aesthetically.

results.title: Adventuring pups
results.creator_credit: Morton Schindel and Young America Films
results.brief_description: A film designed to stimulate observation in the young child, by introducing three puppies, and following their adventures on a farm and in the woods.
